text: Pours hazy apricot with a thick ivory head. Malty, wheaty and fruity aroma is quite tempting. Wheaty, malty and sweet fruity flavor delivers a hint of hops. Body is average, and fizz is typical - but fruity finish makes this satisfying. Drink this Sunbelt!

Bottle at home. Pours cloudy yellow with a large, rocky off-white head, long retention with light lacing. Aroma is earthy, herbal, and spicy hops and wheat malt. Flavor is earthy wheat malt, medium herbal and earthy hops and bitterness with a dry finish. Light body and heavy carbonation.
Golden coloured and unclear. Has a white head, lasting. Sweet aroma, fatty and fruity.

750mL bottle drunk 5/20/15Another great appearance from Jester king; huge, fluffy white head is very well-retained atop a ripe peach-colored body with high clarity, leaving sediment in the bottom.Pure, wonderfully done amarillo in the nose. Heavily floral with just a touch of sweet tangerine and light lime. They are quite uninterrupted by the malts, which, on account of the very low acidity, need very little sweetness to balance. House yeast adds a touch of minerality that is very enjoyable, almost like warm well water. Soft orange blossom-like aromatics continue as it warms while just a touch of light caramel emerges from the cara malt.Very similar flavor profile, hop-forward but with a complete lack of acidity. Very impressive. Wheat gives a softness to the body, though there is a bit of hardness from the carared (wish theyd left that out, but then, I pretty much never like cara malts in light to mid strength beers). Other than that, its just a flowery, soft, incredibly drinkable beer with much more flavor than youd ever expect for its size. No alcohol or flaws. Everything Ive had from these guys that hasnt been oxidized to all hell has been outstanding.
light sweet fryit old ale,orange, hazy, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, light old finish.

Bottle. Creamy White good mostly lasting head. Dark yellow colour. MOderate malty and heavy hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate. Mandarine and week lemon notes. Nice.

Bottle (gusher!). Pours cloudy gold with off-white head. Aroma is wheat, orange peel, lemon zest, and floral hops. Flavor is dry and a little bland with nice hop presence and faint citrus. Light/medium body.

An interesting ale collaborated with a great brewery. Nice aroma and flavor of wheat and floral hips bitterness. Golden and copper color with a light but dry palate. Felt like it needed a little better balance though.

Pours clear light/medium yellow with a large fluffy white head. Sticky, soapy lace.
Fragrant, spicy, floral aroma.
The flavor is somewhat dry, spicy, softened. 
Easy drinking, but nothing really going on that interests me.

750ml bottle thanks to Errl! Pours semi clear orange with big 3 finger head and tons of bubbles. Nose is nice mix of earthy floral fruit, apple, grain, citrus, orange. Taste has nice light body, mixed earthy farm grains, good fruitiness and soft mouthfeel, overall a bit rounded in profile with nothing really jumping out, though perhaps I sat on this bottle too long, still a pleasant easy drinker with nice soft citrus and grain and just a touch of doughy spice.
sort of an overtly hopped session/saison, not really very interesting. decent i suppose.
Keg at the Mikkeller Bar. Pours golden yellow, nose is orange, floral, taste is light pine, bitter.

The beer pours a hazy honey color with a medium white head that burns away steadily. Partial rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of hops, tropical fruit and wheat. Light-bodied with flavors of sweet fruit, herbal hops and wheat. The finish is fruity up front with a grassy hops and wheat aftertaste. Above average overall.

Reviewed from notes, and when this was out, I drank a ton of it. So good. Pours a hazy straw yellow with white head. Hoppy on the nose, citrus, wheat, and some light pine. Finishes clean for the style. Really well done. Very refreshing summer beer, and I hope Jester King makes this again.

Bottle @ 2nd RBBSG. Thanks to 77ships! Pours a hazy apricot color with a big light tan head. The smell is tart, fruity hops, citrus, grass, wheat. The taste is milder than the nose and very nice with citrus, yeast and wheat. The carbonation is active and the bobby light.
Bottle - Wheat and hoppy goodness and a bit of citrus. Cloudy yellow with a creamy white head. Lots of grain and citrusy, juicy hops and a bit of bitterness. Stunning session ale.

Bottle shared at Hunahpu Day in Tampa. Pours a golden haze into my snifter with a one finger white head and decent lacing. Aroma of wheat, light fruits, slight spice, and flowers. Taste is light floral hops, light fruits, bread, cereal, and a balanced malt presence. Dry finish with flowers and cereal.

Bottled: unk

Pours a cloudy blonde ale with a solid sheet of bone whites. Nose is mostly dry with some dust, grain, a bit of resin and citrus - but faint. Flavor is fairly tame with some initial bitterness and then some wheat flavor and some nuttyness that reminds me of Belgian yeast. Thin body et high. Biting carb. Decent beer, nothing special.

(Backlog) Slight haze, golden in color, whitish head. The smell is wheat, definite citrus fruity hops. The taste is wheat, hops, fruits, citrus, mango. Seems like a bigger beer than it is good aroma and taste packed into 4%.

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2015 Color: nice godly blond beer with medium carbonation and big white foam. Smell: wheat, malt and bread with hops. Taste: amazing hoppy taste with good malt equilibrium. Aftertaste : wet hoppy bitterness.

Pours a clear gold with lots of bubbles. Tremendous foamy head that settles eventually leaving sporadic sticky lacing.

Smell is great. A nice wheat base with some crisp clean citrus aroma.

Taste is a bit of a let down after the appearance and smell. Very little of the wonderful citrus from the nose makes an appearance in the taste. Really just a bit of wheat, finishing with a sharp spicy bitterness.

Fairly light and medium-high carbonation levels.

Just ok. If more of the citrus made a flavor appearance this could be a very good beer. As is its good for a lighter ABV beer, but not much more.

Location: 750 ml bottle from a Specs, 9/24/13


Aroma: The aroma has some hop notes, some bready malts, citrus, and a little pine

Appearance: It pours a cloudy golden color with a small, fizzy white head, and spots of lace

Flavor: The taste is much the same, it is mild sweet, with some decent spice, and a mid bitterness

Palate: The body is light-medium, it isnt too watery, had a softish carbonation, and a dryish finish 

Overall Impression: 
I thought this one was decent, but I didnt think it was great. As an overall beer, especially one this low in alcohol, this one has an impressive amount of flavor and character. Jester King tends to nail stuff regularly, and, here, they do it again.

750ml bottle. Pours a slightly hazy, light copper color with a fluffy white head. Aroma is fruity, piney and floral hops. The hops dominate the flavor, but in a pleasant subtle way. Slight grapefruit and apricot notes. The wheat and malts compliment very well with a nice biscuity backbone. 
Crisp and light with moderate carbonation.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 This is the finest hoppy wheat ale I?ve had. It is so clean and bright. Wonderful session ale. You do not sip this beer. You take big manly gulps and sniff back a few tears when the bottle empties.

Bottle from a trade with Errl.  Thanks, Chris!  This ones a bit long in the tooth.  Slightly Amber light brown.  Wheat and some lemon.Taste follows with bit of citrus zip on the end.  Malty but wheat prominent.  Nice complex for a 4%er.  Wish Id tried it fresher but couldnt bring myself to drink this in the winter.

750 ml bottle poured a clear gold with a small lasting white head. Aromas of wheat, straw and lemon zest. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry finish. Flavors of wheat, lemon zest and straw with a crisp dry bitter finish.

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2014 Since now didnt knew style - wow. It is overall more IPA flavored - hops oriented, pours hazy pale yellow with good white cap. Very intense noble American hops, a bit flowery, taste was semisweet with good bitter, long dry finish also bitter. Seems medium body, watery texture. Light sour flavor notes also. Very nice, refreshing one. 
update: loads of grapefruity-juicy, spruce-perfume hops in aroma; reminds me of German weizen with loads of hops. White, thick, rich lasing.

Cloudy yellow with medium white head. Lacing.
Aroma.. nose very enjoyable fruity hoppy. Wheat, citrus, hops, decent malts
Quite bitter for wheat. Medium Sweet, bit dry. 
Very enjoyable and refreshing quality brew

Now this is the type of beer you can drink on a sweltering Texas day right after mowing your acreage and feeling like you deserve a light airy reward.  Floral aroma with hints of raspberry.  Unfiltered wheat with a delightfully refreshing citrus, mildly yeasty taste.  A "close your eyes and smile" sort of beer!  Thank you again, jester king!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Spicy rye and daffodil nose. Milky amber, thick head. Tangy whole lemon and tangerine flavor, dry. Rye present. Light body and refreshing.
Bottle pour is a cloudy gold with a mice white head..Nose is.orange.peel, spice,hop,floral..Taste is light floral,citrus,bitter,hops,light sweetness..Palate is light

750ml bottle in a shaker.  Pours cloudy golden with a lacy, white head.  Aroma of floral and citrusy hops, a little wheat, some pale malts, and light fruits with hints of herbs.  Flavor the same with a nice blend of everything.  Average to lighter texture.  Definitely a beer that I would drink all day if I were hanging out in the sun.

20th January 2012Cloudy amber beer with a good white head. Light frothy palate. Mild zingy orange. Seltzerish minerals. Elderflower floralness. Finishes soft and frothy. Well joined up and easy going.

0.75l bottle shared with the Tasting Crew. This is good looking golden-honey one with a big lacing off-white head. Looks really nice. Good hoppy aroma, some hints of yeasty flowers, mild citrus, grapefruit and its really noseable in general. Good body for a low alco with a nice average carbonation. The taste has lots of citrussy hops, grapefruit, a good dryness with a lingering hoppy finish and aftertaste. Really easy drinking and scary sessionable tasty! 27.07.2012

Bottle from secret Santa 2012 - blutt59. Pours slightly hazy golden color with big white head. Citrus, lemon and wheat aromas with some bread dough. Wheat and dough flavors with some lemon and grassy hops. Light to medium body with moderate carbonation. Thanks Bob.

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Pours translucent pale yellow with fluffy bright white head.  Little lacing, medium body, medium carbonation, and herbal hop aroma.  Taste is herbal hops.

Poured from a 750 ml bottle. Pours a hazy gold with a velvety white head of foam. Aroma is more on the hoppy end of the spectrum. Not much wheaty influence, really. Taste is slightly bitter with an orange citrus presence. Overall, good.
Cat pee and grapefruit aroma.  Pours a cloudy yellow with fizzy white head.  Way too hoppy but a dryness that tempers the bitterness slightly

Bottle shared at my "Massive Mikkeller" tasting. Not sure how long ago this one was bottled up but the age hasnt seemed to affect it at all. The hops are still in your face with a slight hint of wheat and citrus. Very enjoyable and Id love to try this again.

Bottle at  home with my dad. Pour is golden lemon in appearance with a big white head and great lacing. Floral, citrus, lemon, wheat, biscuit, and straw in the aroma. Taste is straw, biscuit, grass, flowers, light honey, pine, and lemon zest, with a light bitter finish. Light body with lively carbonation. Crisp, light and refreshing, with a really great hop presence. One of the best wheat ales I have ever had.

25.4 oz bottle.  Hazy orange brown with a thick foamy head.  Smells super sweet and fruity with clementines and key lime pie.  Creamy with sharp carb and a sappy finish.  Taste is pine, green pepper, toffee and sour banana.  Finishes dry and earthy.

Got this bad boy in a trade, thanks cfh64! Poured from a 750ml bottle into a pint glass.

A: Pours a semi-hazy light orange with with yellow hues intertwined around the edges. Two finger white head forms on the pour that is very bubbly and has some great retention. Nice spider web lace follows down the glass.

S: Nice citrus hops with some grassy notes as well. Slight wheat peaks in on top of that.

T: The taste was a little different from the nose. Grassy with a slight woody note. Mild citrus. Very different.

M: Crisp and light with nice carbonation. Had a very airy mouthfeel and drank just like water.

O: This is the best sessionable beer that Ive ever had. This bad boy drank just like water. I could drink this all day. Great taste and drinkability.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 08-29-2011

Notes from 10/7/11:
Poured 750ml bottle into pilsner glass.

A: Golden-honey colored with large fluffy white head that settles into a nice rim that sporadically laces down the glass. Bit hazy from the yeast.

S: Clean, fresh. Lemon hops, wheat, and a faint sweetness hit the nose.

T: Taste follows the nose. Bready malts with the wheat. Lemon/citrus hops are great.

M: Light, but not thin. Very drinkable and refreshing. I wasnt careful enough toward the end of the bottle to avoid the yeast sediment.

O: Another winner from Jester King. I found this to be a great summer brew alternative to a Hefe. This hop-forward wheat beer is something different in a very good way.

75cl Bottle @ RBBSG, Courtesy of 77ships. Hazy yellow coloured beer with some light carbonation and a small white head. Yeasty light fruity complex aroma. FUll palate. FInish is again some yeasty wheaty fruity touches (almost like hint of blackbarries). Not bad.
Pours a hazy straw color with a large foamy white head that persists. Light yet supple mouthfeel. Notes of pith, white grapefruit, lemon, biscuits, sour grains, and passion fruit.

Bottle 750ml @ ClubGonzo
Pours cloudy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, soap, citrus, grassy and herbs. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with a long dry, herbs and grassy finish. Body is light to medium, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

750 ml. sampled @ RBBSG 2012. At first feared that this might be a tad of, perhaps too old for such a light beer and there are evidently no dates on the American stuff but this was still mighty fine. Hazy orange with a huge white head. Lots of hops in the nose, very fruity, exotic fruits, pine apples, mango, cloud berries,... taste is white bread, lovely exotic hops, quite fruity, mango, pineapple, very fruity yeast, touch cloud berries, light bitter, touch floral in the back, quite zesty as well. Very easy to drink, mighty fine stuff.

And another fantastic brew from Jester King, this one with help from Mikkeller. Cloudy yellow, big white head. Smells nice - lightly floral, with some rose and lavender. Taste is mildly sweet with some notes of pepper and dry, woody hops. Thanks to rougeau13 for the trade!

Bottle, shared with BBGTC. Pours a slightly hazy deep orange body with a huge foamy white head. Lovely. Aroma is floral grassy soapy hops, light malty tones and hints of citric peel. Taste is sharp, dry and bitter citrus tones, mainly grapefruit-like but also a bit orange-ish. Hints of wet leaves and herbs in the back. Dry finish. Full body and medium carbonation. Nice an fresh beer for sure, which definitely gets up the "one more"-finger in the bar if Im there. :-)
Bottle. Golden-orange colour with an off-white head. Aroma is hop, citrus, malt, grass, spices. Flavour is hop, citrus, malt, grass, spices. Nice beer.

750 bottle. Pours bright yellow with a nice thick white head.  Nice mild hop nose-mellow. Taste is very mellow hops that fade on the end. Pretty one dimensional but not obtrusive. thins out on the end-profile doesnt go to the end. Session beer-take it for what it is.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text:
Aroma is citrus & a hint of sweetness. Pours a hazy yellow with a mostly diminishing rocky white head and good lacing. Taste is initially rather mild but the taste builds to a strong grapefruit finish and aftertaste. Medium-light bodied and fizzy. Overall, a refreshing drink for the sunbelt.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Specs.  Hazy pour with a big white head.  Aroma is wheaty, grapefruit, and dust.  Taste is dry, yeasty, lots of citrus, and a dusty finish.

Bottle, 75cl. A huge, fluffy, off-white head forms over a lightly unclear, golden body. The aroma is very citrusy, with grass, some malts and hints of spices and tropical fruits. The flavor is on the fruity side, tropical fruitys mostly, with notes of the white part of orange peel, and a nce bitterness. Full-bodied and pleasantly carbonated. Pleasant bitterness in the end. A tasteful and easy drinkable beer. 120413
Balanced citrus hop aroma. Dry body with some heft from the wheat. Earthiness from the yea sties

11/VIII/2012 75cl bottle @ RBBSG - (2012-903) Thanks to 77ships for sharing the bottle!
Cloudy orange to beige beer, very big aery head, stable, non adhesive. Aroma: very fruity, exotic fruits, pineapple, citrus, grapefruit, ripe mango. MF: ok carbon, light to medium body. Taste: pretty citric start, bitter hops, little piny, hint of bretta? Bit sourish, somewhat grassy. Aftertaste: bitter hops, citrus, somewhat grassy. Pleasant session ale.
Amber pour with small fine head. Aroma is pine, soap, very floral. Flavor is pine, bitter, floral. Very dry beer.

@ 2nd RBBSG, thx to Eugene 75cl
Head: white, foamy, large 
Colour: gold 
Smell: wheats, citric, hops, yeast, very resfreshing ! 
Taste: Very refreshing hopy start followed by a lemony bitter and tiny sour flavour, balanced with grassy notes and a flowery flavour, very nice session beer !
Bottle courtesy of 77ships, thanks!  Cloudy yellow color, massive white head with good retention. Aroma of grass, licorice, scallions. Taste is bitter lemongrass.

Bottle sample @ 2nd RBBSG, August 11th 2012. Courtesy of 77ships.
Dorée, col blanc.
Arôme fruité, houblonné, malt léger.
Palais, légèrement houblonné, note citronnée avec une touche de douceur/sucre. Le point fort ressort des houblons qui viennent donner une belle dimension fruitée à cette bière la rendant facile daccès. Note de grains/froment avec une fine finde bouche assez sèche.
Légère et facile à boire avec ce bon profile grains de froment.

Bottle from Whole Foods. Smells mainly of hops, tastes mainly of hops. Pours a nice cloudy gold, lot of head, some lacing. Too hoppy for me, or maybe I dont like Amarillo hops. Its clearly good... but Id rather drink something else.

Bottle from Kihoskh. Bottle said 4,2%, not 4. Enjoyed in the sun while brewing.
Hazy orange body, big foamy white head.
Aroma of tropical fruits, wheat, yeast.
Taste of citrus, peppers, grapes, pine. Very good body, and taste is full and rich for a 4(,2)% beer. Quite impressive, while Ive had my fair share of Mikkellers, I believe this is my first Jester King. This beer made me want to try more

Cloudy with an enormous fluffy white head. Pungent wheat notes accompagnied by belgian yeast. Hints of citrus and soap. Taste is more towards citrus, with the classic wheat tones as backbone. Dry finish,  ever so slightly sweet. High carbonation, light body.
Really good for the style. Theres a lot going on. Bread, wheat, citrus and floral notes. Nice dry finish.

Towering, dense, fine, lightly yellowish head, reducing itself to fluffy eggwhite over veiled orange beer. Very aromatic, citrussy & resiny hops in force. Yet also garden herbs/weeds and lunaria; rosewater for the sweeter streak and rainwater. Very refreshing; hops, exotic fruit, citrus, rosewater, all diluted with rainwater. Easy drinking indeed. Light, refreshing; faint, but aromatic aftertaste. Very good session beer: mission accomplished.

A few bottles given to me as a wedding gift from a friend in Texas. Pours a cloudy orange colour with a fast acting foamy white head, no real lacing surprisingly. Smells spicy sweet, caramel, fruits. Tastes light and sweet, slight bitter, spice, and fruity. Really good. Ive had a few bottles, one aged after a year and still holds up. There is some oxydization evidence but still great. I would love to have this on tap.

Slightly hazy golden colour, white head, big bubbles. Aroma of American hops, sweet malt, peach, some sweets (zuurtjes). Bitter flavour, hoppy, light sweet malt, light sour touch. Hefty carbonation. Bitter finish.
Very nice beer, bit too much carbo though.
(From 75cl bottle @ ZZT IV. 4.2% ABV Thanks for sharing, Benzai & DutchDrebus!)

Tap at Black Star Co-op and Flying Saucer Austin June 2012- I have to say, this is one of the best beers i have ever had.  small, but with tons of awesome flavors.  I could drink this thing all day and not get tired of it.  Pours lightly hazy yellow with a soapy big bubble head.  WOW-big flowery nose lite farmhouse character, lite lemons, lite woody oak note, some Spice (GOP).  WOW, big gop flavors lemongrass, lite tangy lemons and grapefruit,  Beer actually has a decent amount of bitterness.  long lemongrass and lite bitterness on the finish.  WOW, this is very refreshing and lovely.  This is probably the best wheat beer i have ever had.  Better than Gumballhead by far!  Small enough you can drink it all day yet still have a ton of flavor and character.  close to perfect!

Bottle @ZZT IV:
Medium vast white head which changes slowly into a lacing on top of a hazy yellow with (orange tints) colored beer.
Smell fruit, peach, apricot, meat, hops, light citrus, light yeasty. Pretty crispy.
Taste some hops, fruity hops, citrus, grass, hay, apricot, light sour, light dry, malts, malty bitterness, tend to end up in a nasty bitterness.
Aftertaste is fruity, bitter, light dry and malty.
Full carbo bomb, sparkling mouthful, medium body and a texture which is more watery than creamy.
Good beer, but way too much carbo!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: 750 bottle @Tampa Weekly thanks to -pours cloudy yellow with a white head.  Aroma is soft lemon, grassy.  Taste is soft lemon, grassy, light malt.

Bottle, pours nice hazy gold, massive head. Aroma of hops and hay.  Drinks crisp with hops sharpness at the finish.  Good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
75cl bottle @ ZZT IV. Hazy yellow to orange color, huge rough white head. Smell wheat and hops. Taste hops, bitter, fruity. Medium carbo, suitable body.

Bottle at ZZT4. Golden yellow to orange colour with a decent white head. Smells very hoppy, grapefruit, sharp, fresh, lovely. Tastes hoppy, sharp, bitter, quite nice, apricots, grapefruit. Lots of carbo, medium body. Nice beer.
Dark gold pour, off white head.  Loads of wheat and spice along with some really fresh hop aromas.  Flavor is soft and a bit sweet, wheat up front followed by the citrus and floral hops.

Bottle.
Pours golden amber with a huge white pillowy head.
Lots of oranges, some citrus detergent. Very bitter, light but still with a nice balance.
Bottle. Good balance. Sweet tropical fruits... citrus... bitter finish. Not that complex. Light without being thin. Very quaffable.
On tap. Cloudy medium yellow with a fizzy white head. Aroma and taste of wheat bread strong orange and other citrus and light spice. Not bad.

Great session beer. Grapefruit hops on the nose. Very bitter for a session beer. Really like this.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(75 cl bottle from Toft Vin; BBD: Couldnt find it) Pours a hazy golden with frothy white head and lively carbonation. Aroma is pleasantly hoppy with herbal notes and a twist of tangerine. Light body, oily texture and a somewhat bitter and slightly sour finish. Flavour follows the aroma but also shows slightly sour and spicy notes from the wheat presumably. Surprisingly pleasant and drinkable for a wheat. The Falconers Flight hop seems quite interesting. Girlfriend says: "It has a potent aroma. It goes well with raspberries."

Pours a cloudy golden color with off-white head.  Aroma is citrus, wheat, and cracker/bread.  Taste is semi-sweet and bitter.  Thin bodied and a bitter finish.  Easy to drink, but little to write home about.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2012 (Bottle) Pours hazy orange with a large white head. The aroma holds sweaty pine/resin, fresh herbs/rosemary, spicy grass, sweet grapefruit, orange/passion fruit/pear juice, tangerine nectar, pineapple/peach candy and flowers. Undertones of doughy bread, toast, and light honey like malt. Light touch of smoky and spicy phenols as well as mould cheese. Ginger, coriander, and soft nutmeg. The flavour is dry, medium near bitter and light acidic with notes of spies, herbs, grass, tart fruits, citrus, crackers, dry white bread, phenols and a touch of funk. The mouthfeel is soft, clean and tart with a near medium carbonation.  Herbal, grassy, grapefruity, resinous and cracker-like finish. Light (to medium) bodied.

Lovely. Some yeast in the bottleneck, but that is easily wiped away. Cloudy orange with some floaties.
Lovely hop aroma, wheat malt softness, spices, just the right amount of hoppy dryness. Well balanced, very quaffable.

Bottle at Craigs, thank you!
Belgian yeast and white pepper nose, highly carbonated with a passion fruit, white peppery finish.

On tap. Pours a clear bright golden colour with a medium white head, quite lasting foam. Aroma is hoppy, almost like an IPA. Orange, peach and wheat above all. Taste is similar. Very fruity with peaches and orange peel up front. Some hay notes as well. Body is medium with good carbonation. Overall, nice wheat beer. But I wouldnt complain if they called it an IPA.

On bottle from ölbutikken
Pours foggy yellow low medium frizzy head
Aromas of grape, some sweet fruits. Typical wheat sourness...
Fine tuned palate but nothing extraordinary. Sweet and soir with slighlty bitter ending. Best part is mos def the bottle!
75 cl bottle - pours dark golden with steady creamy head. Nose of peach, some cloves, flower notes. Light body with very lively carbonation. Nice bitterness at the end.

Bottled. Oranger coloured. Almost Murphy. Dense beige head. Aroma of sweetness, fruits, light yeast, spice, Flowers. Flavour of flowers, fruits, sweetness, some caramel, light grape and yeast. Medium bodied. End on a fruity and dry light bitterness. Nice and refreshing.

Bottle. Pours cloudy golden with a huge off-white head. Aroma of fruity lime, citrus and malt. Flavor is sweet toffee with some citrus and lime. Thin body, average carbonation. Nice mix of wheat, bitterness and lime /citrus hops.

Pours nicely carbonated with a large head and light copper body. Smells and tastes of fresh lemon and grapefruit flesh with light wheat backdrop. Perfect summer beer, like a mix between a US ipa and a craft lager. Super drinkable and really tasty, excellent stuff.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared at Klooster.  Cloudy orange pour with white head.  Aroma of barnyard, yeast, malt and hops.  Fruity flavor with wheat ! Citrus and bitter hops.  Slightly high carbonation but pretty good overall.
Nice light orange coloured beer with a nice big white head. Nice hoppy citrus, grass, some spices. Decent but misses a small boost for me.

Tap at Mikkeller Bar, Cph. Hazy golden, nice white head. The aroma is slightly sweet, floral, almost perfumery fruity with a light acidic wheaty touch. Very fresh, actually. The taste is sweet, medium bitter, with light notes of horseblankets, wheat malt, banana and orange. Dry bitter finish. Light body. Quiet lively carbonation. Different from the "original" Mikkeller-version, this is more fruity and, well, actually a little vulgar. And interesting.

Draught at the Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen, Denmark.
Hazy golden amber colour with small white head.
Fruity orangey wheaty malty aroma with mild hops and mild yeast. Nice and interesting aroma. Flavour is very fruity with apricots and oranges, wheat and medium bitterness. Bitterness is quite short. Floury palate.

Hazy orange-amber colored pour. Huge off-white head with plenty of lacing. The beer looks alive as more bubbles rising make the head move up and down. A dry hop aroma with some subtle hints of malt, banana, and lemon. A carbonic bite with some bitterness. A nice, soft hop presence. A little bitterness in the back. Not a bad session beer.

750ml bottle pours a cloudy orange with a thick frothy head.  Aromas of wheat, citrus, barnyard hay, hops and a light bubble gum aroma.  Flavors are a mixture of aromas, hops are there but not overpowering.  A nice easy drinker to enjoy all day.

Bottle @ home. Pours a bright golden orange color. Slightly hazy. Big eggshell white head. Attractive. The aromas of honey, wheat, grass, banana bread. Theres also a hint of hoppy pine and tropical fruits. The taste is pleasing. Initially medium sweet, then hoppy bitter dry finish. A bit woody. Nice. Light body, nicely active carbonation. Overall, this would be a fantastic beer to drink in the garden on a warm summers day. Flavorful, but in no way overbearing or over the top.

Bottle 750ml.ABV: 4.2%. Clear medium orange colour with a huge, frothy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, caramel, sweet malt, moderate hoppy, flowers, perfume, fruity. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20120128]

From a bottle. Cloudy orange gold with fluffy white head. Nice hoppy aroma, tropical fruits, floral, turkish delight. Similar taste, fruity hops, slightly spicy note. Refreshing with a controlled bitterness. Pretty good
Bottle. Pours cloudy orange with a very busy white head. Nice floral nose. Delicious flavour. Floral, light bubblegum. Wheaty. Very clean, dry finish.
Bottle. Pours cloudy orange with white head. Nose/taste of fresh oranges, citrus, hops, banana, clove and yeast. Dryish finish. Medium body.

Chopp on release day. Hazy golden colour with a small steady like white head. Pleasant fresh aroma of citrus fruity hops and wheat, ok sweetness. Good mouthfeel. Flavour is fresh with citrus, fruit, wheat and some malt with some sweetness. Fruity wheaty citrus finish.

75cl bottle from Vino Wines. Pours a slightly hazy golden colour with a thick, rocky white head. Lovely floral aroma with pineapple and peach notes also. A farmhouse aroma leads onto a dusty, dry fruit flavours. Saisony lemon and white pepper with pineapple again. Quite bitter and really interesting. Heavy carbonation and a bone dry finish.
Bottle. Hazy golden with tiny floaties with big off-white head. Aroma is malt, wheat, hops and citrus. Flavour is malt, citrus, hops, pine, fruit and bitter.
Hazy golden with a white head and small floaties. Aroma is sweet, wheaty and rather hoppy - grapefruit. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. ry and moderate bitter finish. 280112
Unclear golden of color with a small off white head, An aroma of dust, hops, citrus, grass and cucumberpeel. A flavor with hops, citrus, leather and bitter.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Huge head with excellent duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are yeast, citrus, wheat malt, flowers, fruits and hops.
Bottle @ Too many Geuzes - only one toilet , Ulfborg 2012. Pours cloudy dark golden with a large white head. Citrus and grapefruit. Easy and very pleasant nose and flavor. Clean. Quaffable thing.

Draft @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a longlasting white head. Has a fruity wheat malty citrus hoppy aroma. Citrus hoppy flavor with weak wheat malty hints. Has a fruity wheat malty hoppy citrus finish.
75cl, at 4.2%Vol, new exclusive American collab. brew Anno 2011, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex brew, malty/bitter and slightly floral/fruity, balanced, hazy, rocky head, nice brew, yet expensive
Dampled at an esbls tasting.  Cloudy golden with a big almost white head.  I smell soft fruit and malt.  Flavor and feel are both on the odd side.  Not enough good stuff going on here.
Sorprenet cervesa de blat. A cata a cegues no ho diria. Bona textura per tenir menys de 5 graus. Aroma a cítrics i final amarg. Molt bona.
Poured a hazy golden color with a huge fluffy white head. Aroma is a lot of hops and citrus zest. Taste is wheat, citrus, and hops. Slightly bitter finish. Very easy to drink. Good beer.
En botella.Color dorado palido con espuma media.Aromas medio intenso a lupulo y citricos, sabor refrescante!
En botella.Rubia con poca turbiedad,aromas florales especiados ,pimienta...refrescante con poca retencion pero con buena carbonatacion.cuerpo ligero.final amarguito.
Bottle at Craigs house. floral, golden, cloudy, frothy, light sweetness, light body, creamy.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2012 Bottle at home ... golden yellow ... thin white head ... soft sweet orange hop  ... zezty floral hop nose ... zezty fruits ... juicy fruits ... little pine bitterness ...  really lovely and drinkable ... poured liek ti would be too fizzy but wasnt ... light easy floralness... cant quite get the flavour but its easy drinkign and damn tasty 3.9
 bottle at home ... ...soft floral fruits ... juicy orange ... fizz/... juicy fruits ... ligt floral orange ... citrus juice ... lovely ... 3.9.. balance is just great .. awsome

Pours hazy burnished brass, with huge fluffy, persistent head.  Fresh, full aroma of spicy yeast, wheat, with overarching apricot lemon hoppiness (reminds me of sorachi ace), citrus rinds.  Taste is crisp, light pear, some banana esthers, light maltiness, orange rind bitter finish, some yeast.  Light palate with good carbonation.  Great session brew, serious flavor bang for your buck.

75 cl bottle from ØlKonsortiet. Pours lovely golden orange with a fluffy white head. Aroma is just full of hops - fresh lemon, grape fruit, unripe pineapple, mango, even tending a slightly liquorihs-like note. Some crisp bready and slightly caramelish malts in the background, which are very nice. Taste is lovely as well. Insisting bitterness in the front of the palate, which lingers on the sides of the tongue, notes of bitter orange peel, citrus fruits, unripe pineapple, a note of liquorice root. Slight traces of the wheat malts, but nothing prominent. Very clean on the palate - light and fresh. Delicious treat before the insane Christmas food later this evening.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy, glowing, golden amber color with a smooth head of off-white foam.  Spotted wet lacing mostly rejoins the body below.  The nose is based in notes of creamy, wheaty cereal grain, quite fresh, with slightly phenolic lemony hop tendencies and mild pithy-floral citrus rind.  It smells light, fresh, and unimposing, overall.  Flavors largely follow suit, crisp and clean in the wheaty malt base, with zesty hops that touch on lemon pith and some less prominent grapefruit rind.  The palate is predictably light and moderately dry, showing fine, sprite carbonation and a crisp finish.  Good stuff.  I could drink a whole lotta this!

Bottled. A hazy golden beer with an off-white head. The aroma has notes of spices, fruits, and flowers. The flavor is sweet with notes of phenols, malt, fruits, and flowers, leading to a dry and lightly bitter finish. The body is light.

750, capped and gushing. Jester King is officially my favorite beer to drink while I am sitting in the kitchen sink. Hazy medium amber with a white sudsy head. Bright grapefruit and orange nose. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Proper brown bread mid palate, nice and wheaty but without too much tang. Mild bready finish.
Nice orangish golden color. Lots of the nice flavors of an ipa but in more of a session ale. Nice easy drinker with some character.

At a tasting, thanks beer and beyond, pours yellow to orange hazy with a huge head, aroma of lemon, peach, canned apricot, warm fruit salad and litchi, flavor of malt, wheat, lemon, lemon grass with some bitterness and mint, quite refreshing, medium bodied, great
On tap. Pours a hazy, pale amber with a dense off-white jead. Fresh if slightly perfumy aroma. Light body, dry fruitiness - dry and citric - with a fairly bitter finish. A lovely session beer. 041211
Incredible aromatic, sleightly hazy amber. Citrus, orangejuice pine needles. Fresh bubbling palate. Mild body with medium bitterness an light malty sweetness
tap at mikkeller bar. Cloudy orange, smooth offwhite head. Mild sweet flowery aroma. Wheaty, dry. Flavor is hoppy, slightly citrussy, quite dry, almost bretty

On tap at MikkellerBar, thanks for sharing Plovmand! Hazy orange colour, white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, pineapple, melon, a bit cloying, leaves, a bit English style. Flavour is cloying fruits, melon and pineapple, citrus bitter finish, light grainy. Light bodied. Not to my taste.

From tap at MikkellerBar. Pours hazy orange with a small white and lacing head. Smooth fruity, oranges and slight peachy. Light yeasty. Mild peppery, lemonish and citrusy. Citric, light sweet and light yeasty mellow finish.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Cph.
Hazy orange amber with a small, creamy, light off-white head. Aroma is delicious, apricot, oranges, light red grapes. Highish carbonation, fine light and dry mouthfeel. Flavour has graininess, caramel, soft bitterness, Flavour has dryness, caramel, light doughy malts. Lingering grassy and lively bitterness. Good beer, even if the original Drink in the sun was far better.
On tap at Mikkeller Bar. It pours hazy yellow with a medium white head. The aroma is very fruity with notes of tropical fruit. Juicy and fruity flavour. Bitter and fruity finish.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar.
Hazy amber coloured with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of hops, citrus and pine needles.
Fruity flavour of hops, citrus and pine needles.
Hoppy finish,
Nose is quite heavy hops, decent leaves, menthol, later celery, feel is mediumbroad, carb is mediumheavy, taste is dry, bitter, and grassy hops, earth, very dry lemon

Fad: Orangegul let diset øl med et fint skumhoved. Duft af amerikansk humle, citrus. Hveden kan ikke rigtig anes. Smagen sidder lige i skabet, masser af saft og kraft selvom den har en lav alkoholprocent. Virkelig en god sessionbeer.

Bottle  Fantômepalooza 2011 Hazy peach-colored ale with a mid-sized, creamy, white head that never comes close to fully dissipating. The bouquet is spicy and citrusy intermingled with notes of apple and pear. Light-bodied with lively carbonation. The taste is moderately spicy, bitter and citrusy  grapefruit and orange peel. Crisp, lightly bitter, refreshing finish. Bottle courtesy of ericandersnavy!
Draught at MikkellerBAR. Cloudy yellow/golden - white head. Soapy. Fruity. Zesty. Citrus. Wheaty. Ok hoppy. Light bitterness. Nice fresh. A bit plain.
750 c&c from ericandersnavy. Pours hazy peach gold. Aroma is ruity/citrus. Med body. Flavor is floral/fruit/citrus over light grain. A hint of yeast. Extremely tasty.

Bottle shared by bhensonb. Pours cloudy golden with a rich beige head and a banana aroma. There is a hearty carbonated wheat flavor with some banana ester and a spicy finish. An interesting wheat beer that is quite hoppy.

On tap at the GABF.
Aroma: citrus, wheat, spice, slight tartness
Taste: spice, wheat, slight tartness
An interesting beer, very refreshing.

Pours hazy brownish orange with a white head. Aroma is corriander, lime, hay, basement, some light dusty hops, some yeast which seemed a bit saisonish, bread straw and a light note of baking yeast. Taste add a bit more citrus and dryness from the yeast. Still got the corriander, lime, hay and dusty hops. Nice

Quite dry for a wheat beer, it has an almost spicy note to it which is similar to the Wytchmaker Rye IPA that Jester King makes.  Color is a nice pale wheat color with suprising clarity to it.  Crisp and neat, a bit light in body.  It is nice to drink but is not my normal kind of wheat beer (Schneider-Wiesse).

Bottle, thanks Søren! Hazy yellow light orange with some sediment, off white head, the color of the beer is reminiscent of morning urine, Aroma: this smells almost like a saison, floral, dandelion, yeast, wheat, lemon zest,  grassy hops, straw, hay, light barnyard, dusty, light mouthfeel, somewhat dry, taste: wheat, grassy hops, citrus, nice bitterness, refreshing, quite yeasty, light banana, MSG, light pear, light apple,

Draft at GABF. Pours a lightly hazed gold with white head. Nose is really nice, lots of citrusy hops and a hint of bready malts. Spicy and floral, really fresh. On tasting, its superb. Light bodied, crisp and fully flavored. Plenty of malt to back up the big dosing of hops. Clean fermentation and just a delightful beer. Fantastic!

Had the opportunity to try this via guest bottle. From 750 ml bottle pours a hazy golden orange colored brew with a decent sized off-white head that leaves behind some excellent lacing. Aroma of farmhouse yeast, some wheat malt, a touch of doppelbock yeast and some tropical fruit. Taste is medium bodied with some complex flavors of farmhouse yeast, wheat, lemon zest and a touch of grass. Finish is semi-dry with a wheat and farmhouse yeast aftertaste.

750ml bottle from Timbo, thanks man 
Appearance: Hazy golden with a big white head and lots of sticky lacing 
Aroma: Yeasty, wheat, lemon and spices 
Taste: Yeast, light malts wheat, grassy and lemon 
Nice, this would be great on a hot summer day.

Bottle, thanks emacgee for sharing.    Cloudy orange with some light bubbles, not much of a head.  Nose is lemon, tropical fruits, a bit of citrus, light wheat.  Flavor is similar--muted, but expected considering the low ABV.  Pretty good, but a little watery.  Luckily not as buttery as the straight Mikkeller version I had back in June.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Thanks beerandbeyond. Hazy golden with a big frothy white head. Pleasant hoppy aroma with lots of citrus, flowers and tropical fruits notes. Hoppy grapefruity flavor with some tropical fruits, mild bitterness and some wheaty fruitiness with some sweetness. Fluffy wheat mouthfeel. Very tasty and quaffable.

Bottle: &nbsp Orangish straw, loads of yeasties at the bottom of this bottle, large foamy off-white head, fairly nice lacing. &nbsp Moderate wheatiness on the tongue, a bit citrusy too! &nbsp Bubbley mouthfeel, moderate body. &nbsp Soft piney citrus, and I mean soft, on the nose. &nbsp Very faint peach/apricot skin on the backside. &nbsp Wheaty finish, a little dry, not as sweet as I would have liked. &nbsp Could use a bit more body, but its clean and light. &nbsp Great for drinking in the sunbelt! &nbsp Thanks for the bottle Bill!

Pours soft golden amber with two fingers of white sticky head.d Nose is nice and hoppy with little to no weisse yeast esters. Light citrus zest and spicy/peppery notes with fresh cut grass and some bread in the back.  Zesty and spicy flavor with a mild bite. Flavor kind of bottoms out, medium body with a dry spicy finish.

750 ml bottle from a buddy in Texas- thanks, Brian! Really nice looking bottle. Pours a cloudy orange-hued gold color with a moderate white head that settles into a lasting film. Aroma of floral hops, pale malts, citrus, soap, grains, grass, and a little tropical fruit. Flavor of citrus, wheaty grains, floral notes, dry crackers, and grass. Light-bodied, with a dry, crisp mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Excellent session beer.
sample at GABF on 9/30/11.  cloudy yellow pour with a small white head.  citrus and spice nose.  big bitter mouthfeel with some lemon notes.  citrus bitter finish with more spices.
Hazey golden-orange with a nice white head.  Hoppy-citrus aroma.  Light wheat spiked with a citrus hoppiness.

BottlePours a lush cheddar orange with a nose of grapefruit, pine and orange peel.  Flavor is, given the ABV, a robust grapefruit and orange.  Slippery mouthfeel.  Excellent.  Take it to every party and forsake BMC.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: On tap at GABF 2011. Pours a cloudy orange color with a medium white head. The aroma is spicy, hoppy notes, some tropical fruit. The flavor is a mix of traditional Wit bier flavors such as spices and dry fruity malts with a lot of sweet hops, very light bitterness. A nice brew. Quite quaffable.

Hazy golden color with lasting ivory foam. Nice fresh cascade, spicy hop citrus aromas. Light to medium bodied. Tasty bready pale wheat flavors with again pine sap, citrus, spicy hoppage--great hot weather brew.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Big thanks to ericandersnavy for this one in trade.  This one had a bit of yeast on the rim of the bottle.  After a wipe it looked good as new.  Pours a hazy yellow with a white head.  Nose is bread, light citrus, and some light caramel with hints of apricot and peach.  Flavor is light and very enjoyable.  4%?  Wow.  Very light, flavorful, and enjoyable.  Sessionable as hell and really nice.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2011 750ml Bottle: Cloudy, with an almost golden-yellow/lightly orange color, yet clearly cloudy with a bubbly white head.  Looks thin.  It has an intense aroma of hops, with a very defined, fresh, floral, spicy, fruity, tropical hop nose thats clean and simple. Flavor is very smooth (thanks, wheat), with an interesting finish thats of really, really intense, fresh hops.  The intensity of the hops, coupled with the thinness of the beer really allows you to experience every aspect of the hop varieties.  Light, tasty and really hoppy, this unusual beer is very impressive.

Cask Conditioned with Amarillo at the brewery: This cask-conditioned version of the Jester King/Mikkeller collaboration, Drinkin the Sunbelt, is dry hopped with (more) Amarillo in the cask.  Making a good cask-conditioned beer that entertains the palate enough without the assistance of carbonation requires a well-crafted beer.  This does not disappoint.  Its smooth, easy, and delicious, with the Amarillo picking up the work in delivering a blast of floral, almost cirtusy hops.  Perfect for summer drinking (hey, Im at the brewery right now, drinkin Drinkin the Sunbelt in the middle of the worst drought in recorded Texas history (at least since the 20s) and its doing a great job of keeping me well-hydrated.  A smoother, easier and less "sparkly" version of the original.
Great aroma, very complex for a wheat ale; floral and citrusy, tropical fruits, wheat and yeast. The taste is really fruity to go along with the wheat and a nice, not really bitter, hop character

750ml bottle from Mora2000, thanks Bill! Pours a cloudy gold-orange colored body with a big, two finger-width, dense and foamy, white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing throughout. Aroma is sweeter lemon and orange citrus florals with a light grass and a light wheat malt. Flavor is similar. Crisp citrus up front with florals and a light grass. Light wheat malts come in to balance with a touch of spice. Yeast comes in at the end as this finishes dry, clean, crisp, and light-moderately bitter with lots of citrus, some grass, and a nice wheat twang. Lengthy aftertaste following a light body and moderately lively carbonation. Overall, a very easy drinking and flavorful beer for being only 4.2% ABV. Lots of clean citruses, a light wheat malt, and some yeast make this dry and refreshing. They nailed this session beer.

750ml bottle. Nice citrus hops aroma, with touch of wheat.  Pours a light hazy gold, with nice head with window lacing.  Taste is citrus twang, little tropical fruit (banana?), underbody is wheat. Finish is ctrusy hops which lingers.  Nice beer.

Bottle. Poured a hazy a pale yellow with a white head that dissipated slowly to the edges. Aroma had a good amount of citrus with some light but sweet wheat, banana and a hint of tropical fruits. Flavor begins with a decent amount of citrus but transitions in to a sweet wheat and tropical fruits. A nice easy drinking beer.
Pours a cloudy golden color with a white head. Has a fruity wheat smell to it. Taste similar to the smell.

bottle; straw yellow pour with big white long lasting head; gave this a 9 for aroma which I never give - much floral hop aroma - great smelling brew.  I am not a fan of hoppy beers usually, but this worked well - light malt good med. mouthfeel and complex hops in middle and on back end.  that is a complex good wheat beer..

Slight haze, golden in color, whitish head.  The smell is wheat, definite citrus fruity hops. The taste is wheat, hops, fruits, citrus, mango. Seems like a bigger beer than it is good aroma and taste packed into 4%.
750ml bottle. Rating #30. Hazy dark yellow with a nice white head. Piney aroma. Nice hop bite, medium aftertaste, pretty tasty. (1854)
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text:
Jester king drinking in the sun. 750ml thanks to Jason... Pours a hazy crisp orange lemon brown and a fluffy white head... Aroma is mostly grassy with citrus and earth... Flavors are totally drinkablewithxa fair amount of citrus and soft grains. Lighter bodied and pretty lively carbonation.quaffable and so drinkable.
7/4/7/4/15
Bottle from kegs and barrels.  Pours a cloudy light amber with a thin white head.  The aromas are bread, light citrus and yeast.  The mouthfeel is doughy and slightly dry with a light body.  Cheers!

A: The pour on this beer is a light orange color with a big white head.

S: Starts off with a fairly strong floral hop aroma.  There is a lot of orange rind and mild citrus sweetness.  Also a mild malty sweetness.  The hops are somewhat perfumey with just a little bit of grass.  A healthy dose of pale, cracker malts and wheat as well.

T: The flavor has a significantly more pronounced citrus character.  Lots of orange peel and fresh, juicy tangerine flavors.  Some floral hops and grass, too.  Plenty of pale malts with a cracker note.  Nice and dry with a soft bitterness, which is good for a beer like this.

M: On the light side of medium in terms of body with a medium carbonation.

O: Really a nice beer.  Well done by Jester King and Mikkeller.

Bottle thanks to Seth...  Bright gold with an orange hue, cloudy, bir bright white head, great lacing in all glasses but the jester king glass... Great subtle nose, wheat with a citrus nose, lemon and a bit of herbs... the taste is a little lighter, really easy to drink, lemon wheat with a touch of spice... Solid session collab

Bottle from Hopper, thanks a bunch!  Pour is a slightly cloudy straw yellow, with a fair amount of billowing white head, great retention and lacing.   Aroma is bready yeast, some fusels, nice citrus hops.  Wet wheat, straw, a bit of grainyness.  Taste is astringent wheat, citrus and floral hops, some fusels that manifest as a bit of medicinal plastic.  Very dry, but still full bodied.   Nice easy drinker.  Thanks!

Bottle shared by cquiroga. Pours with a hazy golden yellow body and a large and lasting white head with good lace. Aromas are fruity, estery, stone fruit, hoppy, citrus. Bready, rainy and wheat like malt profile. Flavors are hoppy, citrus, and grainy. Bone dry. Lightly astringent. Bitter, a hint of light tartness. Medium bubbles, very dry. Tasty. Still drinkable on a 100*F day.

Bottle. Pours a bright gold with a foamy, white head. Nose is citrusy -- lime predominant -- and toasty without the typical wheat beer signature aroma. Drinks -- freaking amazing. It has wheat beer softness and sessionability, but Bes forfend, JK and Mikkeller gave it a big ol backbone of hops and dryness. The perfect sessioner for summer -- even when summer is as dry and hot as it is this year in Texas. Bravo.

Keep buying and liking this. Along with my repetitive "I dont much care for stouts" will now add "wheat beers generally dont do anything for me anymore". That said, this lacks the yeast strains that I know find not so amusing and replaced it with one that has a much drier and more "refined" finish. I want to get another bottle or a few RIGHT NOW. Good stuff. Yeehaw for collaborations that work like this.  Not BEST BEER EVER, but I sure do like the taste and keep wanting more.
orange pour with a thick cream head.  nose is loaded down with citrus, pine, florals, lemon, and light coriander.  great on the palate, flavor is lemon, coriander, wheaty, light hops.  excellent
Bottle at Avery support group. Pours a hazy yellow/gold with white foam. Smells lightly hoppy with hints of lemon and wheat. Tastes surprisingly hoppy with a light overall body.
bottled, hazy golden pour with good lacy foam, aroma is soft yeasty lemon, flavor is smooth lemon and citrus with just right amount of yeast and wheat, great summer beer

Nearly clear yellow with a short-lived white head. Great aroma, very complex for a wheat ale; floral and citrusy, tropical fruits, wheat and yeast. The taste is really fruity to go along with the wheat and a nice, not really bitter, hop character. Very light bodied and smooth with a slight dryness; refreshing without being watery. Quite complex for a session ale, a yardwork ale, or a wheat ale. A touch thin, but very nice.

Poured at first a semi-clear yelllow in colour, but when the copious amounts of dregd were added towards the end of the bottle, it looked like orange juice!! Great mouthfeel and very, very drinkable. And I just love that added bonus of TONS of yeast at the end- yummy!!

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2011 Pours opaque golden orange with a small off-white head; looks a lot like an IPA. Smells very citrusy with American wheat beer characteristics. Tastes like a wheat IPA, strong citrus flavor with a nice malt, wheat backbone. Medium-bodied with a wet texture and mild mouth-carbonation; Drinkin The Sunbelt finishes with a light bitterness and a crisp refreshingness.

On tap at Flying Saucer. Pours a cloudy yellow with a medium frothy hea that lasts awhile. The aroma is citrus wheat and fruit. Thin mouthfeel with a fruity citrus light hop with a nice crisp finish. Easy to drink, a good wheat from Jester King.

Oh yeah. Cloudy nectarine color. Nice white head, which is always nice. Tastes like pure citrus refreshment. A lot of orange a little bit of lemon, and no, there is no lemon in mine, I correctly declined. The texture has a light citrus syrup quality to it. Good job for summer,  no doubt.
Cloudy yellow with a big, long-lasting head. The balance between the wheat and hop elements is outstanding with lots of hop flavor but not so much the bitterness.

On draught at Flying Saucer. Pours pale and cloudy with a rocky head that lasted to bottom of glass. Incredible lacing. Great aroma.  Awesome hop bitterness. I wish more craft brewers would brew session beers like this instead of alcohol bombs.

Pours a gold, lightly hazed .. foam was good, lacing better .. . light wheat, light grain, light citrus and light bitterness .. . a damn fine session brew but not awfully complex or full, but as the name suggests, made for drinking out in the texas heat.. a very enjoyable collaboration .. . I went to a fancy french restaurant called "Deja Vu." The headwaiter said,
"Dont I know you?"
Yellow and a bit hazy - really nice head.  Some typical wheat beer flavor with tons of hops which is actually good and different for a wheat beer.  Thanks to T&P Tavern for having this one on tap.

On tap at The Common Table.

The beer pours a hazy yellow color with a large white head. The aroma is a great mix of wheat with some grassy and citrus hop notes. You can really get the Amarillo hops in the aroma. 

The flavor is also very hoppy. There are a lot of citrus and grass notes mixed in with the nice wheat backbone. Light to medium bitterness and very easy to drink. For such a low alcohol beer, it is packed full of flavor. 

Medium mouhfeel and medium carbonation. Outstanding.
On tap at holy grail. Poured yellow with a white head that wouldnt give up. Aroma and flavor were both huge fruity and floral notes and an awesome bitter. Great beer by a great brewery.

Tap at the Moth. Very glad to see this. This beer pours a cloudy light orange to almost gold pour. Big white head response. They had to pour it several times before it calmed down. 

The aroma is very hoppy, but in the harsher sense. Small lemon citrus notes with a fat punch of almost catty hops. Some sweet fruit prevails. 

Watery mouthfeel with honestly a weak flavor. Very bitter hops on the flavor with maybe some sweet fruit? Whatever redeeming qualities it may have is demolished by the SUPER bitter hop flavor. 

Too bitter, not enough malt/grain backbone to support it. It was an interesting idea to collaborate with a world renown brewer, but this fell short

(draughtnat meddlesome moth) pours a cloudy glowing orange, with a big frothy and creamy eggshell-colored head. nose of orange peel, wheat bread, fresh citrusy hops, and candied fruit. Taste of wheat, orange, medium citrus bitterness, bready, creamy, delicious linger. Really a great beer!

On tap - Holy Grail Pub. 
Cloudy orange color, nice amount of sticky white head.  Wonderful aromas of wheat, citrus, and pine.  Nice mouthfeel for the low ABV, very refreshing and drinkable. Slight wheat bite but dominated by a delicious orange and pine hops.  And here I thought I didnt like wheat beers!

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2011 On tap....pours a cloudy light orange with rich, sticky white head. Aroma is extremely pleasant, notes of floral, citrus, farmhouse, pine. Flavor has a complex but yet very nice balance of lemon peel, pine, light wheat malt and very subtle dusty farmhouse with a pleasant light tart bitter in the finish. Mouthfeel is light body with soft, high fizzy carbonation. Overall, very tasty, easy drinking, very refreshing brew!

(Draught)  Pours a cloudy golden body with a moderate white head.  Aroma of pineapple, grass, orange, wheat, pine, and florals.  Flavor of wheat, pine, florals, toasted grain, and orange with a dry, bitter finish.

16 oz. pint glass at the Draught- Holy cow, it looks like a beer for once!!!  Very heavily cloudy (to the point where the sun refuses to pass through-almost) faded cut wheat straw color (ask this old farmboy), creamy 3mm head formed and laced picture perfectly upon the vessel.  Aroma of oranges, piney hops, yeast, and smiles from that one blonde haired, blue eyed girl that always winks at you.  Hits the mouth with an even medium body, malt is light to the tongue but still powerful enough to be enjoyable, some pepper and coriander (with a very light note of parsley) in the middle, finish lingers and makes your heart sing.  One year ago MIkkeller himself posted in the Austin forum here on RateBeer that you should keep an eye on these guys.  I had my doubts.  Im man enough to say that I owe him, as well as the crew at Jester King an apology, a firm handshake, and an offer to purchase a brew for them.  Very well done.  And congrats, you just cracked this hard ass top 30 brews!

Draught. Beautiful pour. Cloudy bright orange with a thin head that laces nicely. Aroma is all citrus, mostly tangerine. Really interesting palate. Great body with some prickly spiciness and a bone dry finish. Immensely refreshing balance of sweet, spice, and a firm orange-peel bitterness.
